revised_title: Approximation of Logarithms of Algebraic Numbers
tldr: The author presents a new identity to obtain infinitely many algebraic functions that approximate the logarithmic function. They also provide a lower bound for the distance of logarithms from variable algebraic numbers and prove that the fractional part of a number is greater than a certain value for every sufficiently large positive integer. This work improves upon earlier results and provides a more accurate measure of transcendency for logarithms of algebraic numbers.
